title: 107_hr874
content: The "Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001" is the short title of this Act, which includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act also specifies that no changes in tax rates will apply to section 15 of the Code. Additionally, there is a reduction in marginal income tax rates for individuals outlined in the Act. The Act includes a reduction in marginal income tax rates for individuals, specifically for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. For taxable income not over $12,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $12,000 but not over $45,200, the tax is $1,680 plus 15% of the excess over $12,000. For income over $45,200 but not over $109,250, the tax is $6,660 plus 27% of the excess over $45,200. For income over $109,250 but not over $166,450, the tax is $23,953.50 plus 30% of the excess over $109,250. For taxable income over $166,450 but not over $297,300, the tax is $41,113.50 plus 35% of the excess. For income over $297,300, the tax is $86,911 plus 38% of the excess. Heads of Households have a separate tax table for their taxable income. If taxable income is not over $10,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $10,000 but not over $36,250, the tax is $1,400 plus 15% of the excess over $10,000. For income over $36,250 but not over $93,600, the tax is $5,337.50 plus 27% of the excess over $36,250. For income over $93,600 but not over $151,600, the tax is $20,822 plus 30% of the excess over $93,600. For income over $151,600 but not over $297,300, a separate tax table applies. For unmarried individuals with taxable income over $151,600 but not over $297,300, the tax is $38,222 plus 35% of the excess. For those with income over $297,300, the tax is $89,217 plus 38% of the excess. If taxable income is not over $6,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $6,000 but not over $27,050, the tax is $840 plus 15% of the excess over $6,000. For income over $27,050 but not over $65,550, the tax is $3,997.50 plus 27% of the excess over $27,050. For income over $65,550 but not over $136,750, the tax is $14,362.50 plus 30% of the excess over $65,550. For taxable income over $136,750 but not over $297,300, the tax is $35,752.50 plus 35% of the excess. For income over $297,300, the tax is $91,945 plus 38% of the excess. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to a specific tax determined by a table based on their taxable income. For taxable income over $6,000 but not over $148,650, the tax rates are as follows: 14% of taxable income for income not over $6,000, $840 plus 15% of the excess over $6,000 for income over $6,000 but not over $22,600, $3,330 plus 27% of the excess over $22,600 for income over $22,600 but not over $54,625, $11,976.75 plus 30% of the excess over $54,625 for income over $54,625 but not over $83,225, and specific tax rates for income over $83,225 based on a table. For taxable income over $83,225 but not over $148,650, the tax rate is $20,556.75 plus 35% of the excess over $83,225. For income over $148,650, the tax rate is $43,455.50 plus 38% of the excess over $148,650. Phasein of 2006 Rates of 10, 15, 25, and 33 Percent for taxable years beginning after 2002. In taxable years after 2002, tax rates determined under subsections (a), (b), (c), or (d) will be based on the rates from 2002, with reductions in certain cases. The 14 percent rate decreases by 1 percentage point annually from 2003 to 2006, while the 27 and 35 percent rates decrease by 1 percentage point in 2004 and an additional 1 percentage point in 2006. In taxable years after 2002, tax rates are adjusted annually. The 14 percent rate decreases by 1 percentage point each year from 2003 to 2006, while the 27 and 35 percent rates decrease by 1 percentage point in 2004 and an additional 1 percentage point in 2006. The Secretary will adjust the tables to reflect these reductions. In subsection (f) of section 1, amendments are made to adjust tax rates annually from 2002 onwards. The 14 percent rate decreases by 1 percentage point each year from 2003 to 2006, while the 27 and 35 percent rates decrease by 1 percentage point in 2004 and an additional 1 percentage point in 2006. The Secretary will make no adjustments to dollar amounts for certain brackets for taxable years beginning in calendar years after 2001 and before 2007. The tax rates are adjusted annually from 2002 onwards, with decreases in rates for certain brackets. No adjustments will be made to dollar amounts for specific brackets for taxable years after 2001 and before 2007. In later calendar years, the cost-of-living adjustment will be determined by substituting '2005' for '2000'. The tax rates are adjusted annually from 2002 onwards, with decreases in rates for certain brackets. No adjustments will be made to dollar amounts for specific brackets for taxable years after 2001 and before 2007. In later years, the cost-of-living adjustment will be determined by substituting '2005' for '2000'. Additionally, various provisions are amended by replacing '1992' with '2000' in multiple sections. The listed sections include various tax codes such as Section 151(d)(4), Section 220(g)(2), Section 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), and others. Section 6323(i)(4)(B), Section 6334(g)(1)(B), Section 6601(j)(3)(B), and Section 7430(c)(1) are amended. Sections 25A(h)(1)(A)(ii) and 25A(h)(2)(A)(ii) are amended by striking certain text. Subclause (II) of section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) is amended. Additional conforming amendments include changes to Section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) and Section 1(h). In summary, various sections of the Code are amended by reducing the percentage rates specified in the paragraphs. For example, the percentage rates are changed from 28 percent to 15 percent, 39.6 percent to 33 percent, 7, 15, 28, or 31 percent to 5, 10, 15, or 25 percent, and 15 percent to 10 percent in different sections. The Code is amended by reducing percentage rates in various sections, such as changing from 28 percent to 15 percent, 39.6 percent to 33 percent, and 31 percent to 25 percent. The Secretary of the Treasury may adjust these percentages to align with other specified rates. The amendments made by this section of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001, with specific withholding provisions effective for amounts paid after the same date. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF PHASEOUTS OF DEDUCTION FOR PERSONAL EXEMPTIONS AND ITEMIZED DEDUCTIONS. Repeal of Phaseout of Personal Exemptions: Subsection (d) of section 151 is amended by striking paragraph (3) and making technical amendments to section 1(f) and section 151(d). Paragraph (4) of section 151(d) is amended to increase the dollar amount in paragraph (1) for taxable years after 1989 based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Repeal of Overall Limitation on Itemized Deductions in Section 68 for calendar year 2000. Amendments made to various sections for technical adjustments. The table of sections for part I of subchapter B of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 68, effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001.
